org.springframework.social.vkontakte.api

Interface WallOperations

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WallTemplate

    public interface WallOperations
    Interface defining operations that can be performed on a VKontakte wall.
    Author:
    vkolodrevskiy

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Post getPost(java.lang.String userId, java.lang.String postId)
      Get current user's post by post_id.
      java.util.List<Post> getPosts()
      Retrieve wall posts for the authenticated user.
      java.util.List<Post> getPosts(int offset, int limit)
      Retrieve wall posts for the authenticated user.
      java.lang.String post(java.lang.String message)
      Posts a status update to the authenticated user's wall.
      java.lang.String post(java.lang.String message, java.util.Properties params)
      Posts a status update to the authenticated user's wall.
      java.lang.String post(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String link)
      Posts a status update with an external link to the authenticated user's wall.

    • Method Detail

      • post

        java.lang.String post(java.lang.String message,
                    java.util.Properties params)
        Posts a status update to the authenticated user's wall. Requires "wall" permission.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to post.
        params - other parameters to post ("owner_id", "friends_only", "from_group", etc)
        Returns:
        the ID of the new wall entry.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.social.ApiException - if there is an error while communicating with VKontakte.
        org.springframework.social.MissingAuthorizationException - if VKontakteTemplate was not created with an access token.
        VKontakteErrorException - if VKontakte returned error.

      • post

        java.lang.String post(java.lang.String message)
        Posts a status update to the authenticated user's wall. Requires "wall" permission.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to post.
        Returns:
        the ID of the new wall entry.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.social.ApiException - if there is an error while communicating with VKontakte.
        org.springframework.social.MissingAuthorizationException - if VKontakteTemplate was not created with an access token.
        VKontakteErrorException - if VKontakte returned error.

      • post

        java.lang.String post(java.lang.String message,
                    java.lang.String link)
        Posts a status update with an external link to the authenticated user's wall. Requires "wall" permission.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to post.
        link - external link to be shared on user's wall
        Returns:
        the ID of the new wall entry.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.social.ApiException - if there is an error while communicating with VKontakte.
        org.springframework.social.MissingAuthorizationException - if VKontakteTemplate was not created with an access token.
        VKontakteErrorException - if VKontakte returned error.

      • getPosts

        java.util.List<Post> getPosts()
        Retrieve wall posts for the authenticated user.
        Returns:
        list of wall posts, up to 100 (VK default)

      • getPosts

        java.util.List<Post> getPosts(int offset,
                            int limit)
        Retrieve wall posts for the authenticated user.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to start retrieving posts.
        limit - the maximum number of posts to return.
        Returns:
        list of wall posts

      • getPost

        Post getPost(java.lang.String userId,
           java.lang.String postId)
        Get current user's post by post_id.
        Parameters:
        userId - vkontakte user id
        postId - post_id
        Returns:
        existing user's wall post
        Throws:
        VKontakteErrorException - if VKontakte returned error.
